result.execSummary:
The defendant Renaldo G Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 95 days, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Indiana.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  The dept shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charges made against the deft.  Probation may be transferred to Indiana.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, the repeater enhancer is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; credit for 95 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.  Court does not oppose transfer of probation to the State of Indiana.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Atty Hertz-McGrath requests a plea hrg date approx 90 days out; no objection by the State.  Plea hrg set for 10/21/15 @ 1:30pm
